title: Auto Expo 2023: Suzuki Corp announces global unveil of first EV as eVX - ETAuto
summary: Maruti Suzuki showcased the electric SUV eVX concept at the Auto Expo 2023, showcasing commitment to sustainable motoring. The Concept eVX will be powered by a 60 kWh battery pack offering up to 550 km of driving range and will be brought to market by 2025.
green_innovation: TRUE, it describes a concept electric SUV that has a 60 kWh battery pack offering up to 550 km of driving range, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals, such as decarbonization.
business_innovation: TRUE, it describes a product that is new and significantly different from the firm's previous products which has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, it describes a product that is designed and developed in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact and promotes both ecological and human health benefits.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific new or improved business process for one or more business functions.

title: How Recode's Shark Tank Rejection Boosted Its Growth ? - Indian Retailer
summary: Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) brands in India are ramping up their offerings, building their inventory, and increasing tech capabilities and marketing functions in anticipation of a strong festive season. Some of the strategies these brands are employing include expanding product offerings, revamping their supply chain networks, and integrating technology. Many of these brands are also expecting to see a significant increase in sales during the festive season.

title: JK Tyre launches three off-the-road tyres at Bauma Conexpo 2023 - ETAuto
summary: JK Tyre launched three new off-the-road (OTR) tires at the Bauma Conexpo 2023 in Greater Noida, India. The new tires are designed for use in mining, construction, and other industrial applications. The tires are designed to provide high traction, mileage, and cut resistance, and are also resistant to wear and tear and external damage.

title: Rising production, EV transition, and global demand light up future of Indian tyre industry - ETAuto
summary: The Indian tyre industry is experiencing significant growth due to the country's robust automotive manufacturing sector. The government's PLI scheme and other initiatives are supporting the industry's growth. Tyre manufacturers are also innovating to meet the demands of new mobility vehicles, such as EVs.
